<p>CHARLESTON, W.Va. -- West Virginia American Water has lifted a boil-water advisory for about 100 to 125 customers along both sides of W.Va. 16 including Woodland Road, both sections of Goose Creek Road, Oakridge Road, Old Court Street and Fayette Station Road in the Fayetteville area. The advisory was issued June 9 following a water main break.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-608361">

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {

                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }

Boil Water Advisory Extended For Sandy Creek and Lacona Residents

Written by Submitted article, Jun 11, 2013, Comments Off

SANDY CREEK – Residents of the villages of Sandy Creek and Lacona are being advised by the Oswego County Health Department to continue to boil all water used for drinking and cooking due to a water main break in the municipal water system last week. This order has been extended until tomorrow, Wednesday, June 12.

Officials said the water system lost pressure on Thursday, June 6, which increased the chances that untreated water and harmful microbes could enter the system. The water main break has been repaired and officials are now waiting for final test results of the water.

Residents are advised to let water boil for one minute before using it, or to use bottled water certified for sale by the New York State Department of Health. Boiled or bottled water should be used for drinking, making ice, brushing teeth, washing dishes, and food preparation until further notice. Boiling kills most bacteria and other organisms in the water.

According to Oswego County Public Health Director Jiancheng Huang, “Harmful microbes in drinking water can cause diarrhea, cramps, nausea, headaches, or other symptoms. They may pose a special health risk for infants, some elderly, and people with severely compromised immune systems. The symptoms above are not just caused by organisms in drinking water. If you experience any of these symptoms and they persist, you may want to seek medical advice.”

Residents will be informed when tests confirm that no harmful bacteria are in the system and they no longer need to boil their water.

For more information, contact the Sandy Creek/Lacona Joint Water Works at (315) 387-5781 or the Oswego County Health Department at (315) 349-3557.

By
KEVIN WELCH
kevin.welch@amarillo.com

Mandatory boil-water notice issued for northeast Amarillo

Boil-water notice issued for areas in yellow.

A broken water main has lowered water pressure in east Amarillo enough the city has issued a mandatory boil-water notice.

 

A caller reported the 20-inch main break on Amarillo Boulevard near English Road at 6:30 p.m. Sunday. By 11:45 p.m., water pressure had dropped below 20 pounds per square inch. Under those conditions, Texas Commission on Environmental Quality regulations require notification to customers in the affected area to boil water before drinking or cooking with it.

“At 20 psi, you have enough pressure to prevent inflow,” said Floyd Hartman, assistant director of utilities. “Under that, stuff can come in like contaminents.”

Notification is being made in person or by hanging notices on doors.

“The water should be brought to a vigorous rolling boil and then boiled for two minutes. In lieu of boiling, you may purchase bottled water,” the release said.

The city will notify customers when conditions are safe to stop boiling water.

The city has to send bacteriological tests to the state regulators to get approval to remove the boil order.

“Because of the magnitude of the area, we can’t just disinfect the line and resume service,” Hartman said. “I have to have assurances before we give notice the order is lifted.”

The city is asking residents to avoid any unnecessary water use.

Affected customers: 9500–9700 blocks of Crystal Avenue, 8500– 15300 blocks of Amarillo Boulevard East, 1100-1300 blocks of Folsom Road, 10001-10200 block of Triangle Drive, 1800–2000 blocks of English Road, Potter County Detention Center, East Campus of Amarillo College, Highland Park School, National Weather Service and about 500 homes in Highland Park Village.

CFPUA crews working on broken water line, boil water advisory issued

By: Jon Evans, Anchor
BioEmail
Connect
Biography
jonevans@wect.com
Cape Fear Public Utility Authority has issued an advisory as crews work to fix a broken water line

WILMINGTON, NC (WECT) – The Cape Fear Public Utility Authority has issued a precautionary Boil Water Advisory for portions of the South Forest Hills section of Wilmington.

Crews are on the scene trying to repair three breaks in a water line that happened Monday afternoon,  impacting between 80 and 120 customers in the 1900 through 2000 blocks of Dawson Street Extension including Trolley Path, and 2200 through 2400 block of Wrightsville Avenue.

The water main being repaired is more than 60 years old.  It is estimated this repair will take 6 to 8 hours.

According to a CFPUA release, periods of low or no pressure in the distribution system elevate the risk for back siphonage and introduction of bacteria into the water system.  CFPUA officials say that when water service is restored, the residents at the above addresses boil their water for at least one (1) full minute prior to human consumption until otherwise notified.  Human consumption includes cooking, making ice, drink mixing, food preparation and hand washing.  Affected customers do NOT need to boil water prior to using it for bathing.

Monday, June 10, 2013

Weather Boil order at resort, Mount Ida

Posted By Leslie Newell Peacock on Mon, Jun 10, 2013 at 9:07 AM

The Montgomery County Regional Water Authority has issued a precautionary boil order for folks in Mount Ida and Oden/Pencil Bluff, an area that includes the Mountain Harbor resort and condos on Lake Ouachita.

The storms that passed through two weeks ago not only raised the water level on Lake Ouachita six feet, they flooded the county reservoir, sending debris and creating a "spike in turbidity," the authority says in its boil order to residents. Water is being tested in Little Rock today; residents and summer vacationers should hear something from the Authority tomorrow on when the order is lifted.

The authority recommends tossing all ice cubes and boiling water for one minute prior to drinking or using for cooking and cleaning.

Tags: Montgomery County Regional Water Authority, Mountain Harbor, Mount Ida, Weather

The advisory was issued Friday for residents in the Hill-n-Dale subdivision and will remain in effect until June 10, at 12 p.m.

<script type="text/javascript">var _ndnq = _ndnq || []; _ndnq.push(['embed']);</script>
</div>
<p>* West Virginia American Water has lifted a boil-water advisory for approximately 200 customers in 2970 to 3250 of Pennsylvania Avenue, John Wesley Drive, Seneca Drive, Viking Road, Church Road, Elkdale Road, Riverdale Road, Avondale Road and Ruth Street.* The Department of Health and Human Resources has lifted the boil-water advisory for the Rhodell Water Works. * Kanawha Falls Public Service District has lifted the boil-water advisory for water customers in the Charlton Heights-Glen Ferris area.* The McDowell County Public Service District has lifted the boil-water advisory for water customers from English to Yukon No. 2.* Rupert Water Department has issued a boil-water advisory for Western Greenbrier Middle School.Customers in that area should boil their water for at least one full minute prior to use until further notice.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-608361">

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#tncms-region-asset_side_sticky');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

Sandy Creek and Lacona Residents Need to Boil Water Due to Water Main Break

Written by Submitted article, Jun 6, 2013, Comments Off

SANDY CREEK – Residents of the villages of Sandy Creek and Lacona are being advised by the Oswego County Health Department to boil all water used for drinking and cooking due to a water main break in the municipal water system. This order will be in effect until at least Tuesday, June 11.

Officials said the water system lost pressure this morning, June 6, increasing the chances that untreated water and harmful microbes could enter the system.

Residents are advised to let water boil for one minute before using it, or to use bottled water certified for sale by the New York State Department of Health. Boiled or bottled water should be used for drinking, making ice, brushing teeth, washing dishes, and food preparation until further notice. Boiling kills most bacteria and other organisms in the water.

“Harmful microbes in drinking water can cause diarrhea, cramps, nausea, headaches, or other symptoms,” said Oswego County Director of Public Health Jiancheng Huang. “They may pose a special health risk for infants, some elderly, and people with severely compromised immune systems. The symptoms above are not just caused by organisms in drinking water. If you experience any of these symptoms and they persist, you may want to seek medical advice.”

Repairs are under way and will be completed as soon as possible. Residents will be informed when tests confirm that no harmful bacteria are in the system and people no longer need to boil their water.

For more information, contact the Sandy Creek/Lacona Joint Water Works at (315) 387-5781 or the Oswego County Health Department at (315) 349-3557.

<div class=" withRelated right" id="WNStoryBody"><span id="WNStoryDateline">WHITEASH, IL (KFVS) -
            </span><p style="margin-top: 0px;">The Village of Pittsburgh Public Water Supply has lifted a precautionary boil water order for customers in Whiteash.</p><p style="margin-top: 0px;">The order was related to a water break. </p><p style="margin-top: 0px;">For more information, call the Pittsburg Water Office at 618-993-8260.</p><p style="margin-top: 0px;"><i>Copyright 2013 <a class="" href="http://kfvs12.com">KFVS</a>. data-disqus-identifier="16144230">0</span></a></div></div>
<div class="content-main-image">
<img alt="Boil Order Lifted in Bradenton" class="img-responsive center-block" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/61838/2013/06/T800x600/51308b1cf1137abf6852938859f14bc.jpg"/> </div>
<div class="content-body center-block" id="article-wrapper">
<p>The boil water notice in Bradenton is now lifted in the area of Cortez Road.  <br/> <br/> The city received the laboratory results from water testing that shows satisfactory completion of the bacteria surveys showing that the water is safe to drink.  </p> <p>City crews are passing out flyers now. </p> <p>The city of Bradenton issued the "boil water" notice on Tuesday, June 4, to allow for the repair of a broken water valve in the area of Cortez Road.</p> <p>The sampling was done as a precaution.</p><div id="in-article-boxed-recirc"><div class="text-center air-md"><a category="subscribe" class="btn btn-lg btn-cta-alt pill sans in-article-subscribe l-bold" href="/" trigger="article_button_click">   Subscribe  <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-angle-right fa-lg"></span></a></div></div> </div>

Boil water order issued for Wyatt, Wilson City

MISSISSIPPI COUNTY, MO (KFVS) -

A boil water order has been issued for Wyatt and Wilson City.

The order will be in place until further notice.

No details are available at this time as to why the order was instated.

    lastDate = lastDate.getTime();
    
    if(Number(lastDate)<Number(expireDate)){
        __tnt.log("resetting restrictions");
        var nextDate = new Date(expireDate+(__tnt.metering.config.days * 86400000));

        __tnt.recent.count.set(0);

    }
});

    var recent = __tnt.recent.assets.get();
    var uuid = __tnt.metering.config.uuid;
    
    var check = false;
    var i = 0;
    while(!check && i < recent.length){
        if(recent[i]==uuid){
            __tnt.log("found asset in recent");
            var check = true;
        }
        i++;
    }    
    
    if(check){
        __tnt.log("user has read this already");

    var cleanedReferrer = String(String(window.document.referrer).split('?')[0]).replace(/https\:\/\/|http\:\/\//,'').replace(/www/,'');
    var check = false;

var bloxHasSubscription = false;
            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4592);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5585);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4487);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4488);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4489);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://cumberlink.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });


    </script>

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>HAMPDEN TWP. - Approximately 50 United Water customers were without water Wednesday afternoon after an eight-inch water main broke in Cumberland County.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>United Water spokesman Bob Manbeck said the area affected by the break is near Berkshire Drive and Salem Church Road in Hampden Township.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/cumberlink.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Service was restored at around 6:30 p.m., but the affected homes will be under a boil water advisory for a minimum of 48 hours, as recommended by Pa. Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) regulations.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/cumberlink.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>Residents told abc27 News they received notices on their doors with instructions for how to proceed.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/cumberlink.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Manbeck said they do not yet know what caused the break.</p>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

</div></div></div><script>
        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#tncms-region-asset_side_sticky');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://cumberlink.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=b1d506ae-ce9d-11e2-85dd-001a4bcf887a&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://cumberlink.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=b1d506ae-ce9d-11e2-85dd-001a4bcf887a&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != 'b1d506ae-ce9d-11e2-85dd-001a4bcf887a') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://cumberlink.com/tncms/block/1421566/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

Water main break in Mechanicsburg forces boil water advisory for some United Water customers

Print Email
Jeffrey A. Johnson | jjohnson@pennlive.com By Jeffrey A. Johnson | jjohnson@pennlive.com The Patriot-News
Email the author | Follow on Twitter
on June 05, 2013 at 6:15 PM, updated June 05, 2013 at 6:34 PM
comments

A water main break that occurred Wednesday in Mechanicsburg has forced a boil water advisory for some United Water Pennsylvania customers.

The affected streets are: Berkshire, Brandy, Chesterfield, Forest, Linden and Salem Church Road.

A break occurred in an eight-inch diameter water main on Berkshire Lane and required United Water to shut down water to customers in the immediate area. Repairs were expected to be completed early Wednesday evening. The cause of the water main break is undetermined.

The boil water advisory is expected to last at least 48 hours, according to Bob Manbeck, spokesman for United Water.

People should not drink water without boiling it first and allowing it to cool. People with severely compromised immune systems — including infants and some elderly — may be at increased risk.

These people should seek advice about drinking water from their health care providers. General guidelines on ways to lessen the risk of infection are available from EPA's Safe Drinking Water Hotline at 800-426-4791.

This post has been updated to correct a prior spelling error.

Some Marcelline, Ursa Township residents under boil order

Posted:
ADAMS COUNTY, Ill. (WGEM) -

Clayton-Camp Point Water Commission customers in Marcelline and several sections of the Ursa Township are under a boil order until further notice.

Ursa Township sections under the boil order include 6, 7, 12, 31 and 32.

Manager John McMahon says a water main was damaged when a contractor struck the pipe.

ABS Water Cooperative customers north and west of Marcelline are also under the boil order.

Related stories

  • Water service restored to West Side residents
  • Water service restored to West Side; boil advisory in effect
  • Crash causes water main break, affects West Side communities

Pennsylvania American Water customers in Plymouth, Pringle,  Larksville, Edwardsville, and Courtdale no longer have to boil their water before use.

Acceptable bacteria test results were obtained from samples collected on June 3 and June 4, and the Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Protection has authorized lifting of the precautionary advisory.

The boil advisory was issued June 2 due to low tank levels caused by a damaged fire hydrant.
